column4: What kernel should I use with a P4 HT Processor? I can't find much on the web and what I have found conflicts.
I don't know, asking for a friend buying hardware ..... want to give the best advice I can.
that was me saying "either will work fine"
sorry .... I'm reading you, Dr_ and 4 others who pm'd me
bind problems?

Network-Manager requires bind9 and so its installed and starts on boot as it should. However, Network-Manager also calls bind directly, giving you 2 bind processes that are obviously conflicting. A restart of the regular bind process resolves the problem .... but you must do that everytime the machine boots or no resolution.
I had no conflict
how many bind processes do you have running at the moment AND are you using 127.0.0.1 as your only name server in resolv.conf?
I have 3 named process running
and is 127.0.0.1 the only name server specified in resolve.conf? I ask because if you have an outside nameserver specified, you wouldn't notice this problem
excuse me, resolv.conf
127.0.0.1 is all that's in there

any ideas then? On boot, with Network-manager installed I get no resolution unless I restart bind (it times out). Without Network-Manager installed bind loads fine and resolution is good. All was installed via apt and bind and dhcbdb were installed as dependancies by apt.
disturbingly, mine seems to listen on all interfaces
is your resolution doggy or intermittant at all, anytime?
no
are you running Breezy?
yes
JK ..... I guess your one of the lucky ones. Syruss and I are having the same problem.
not unless they're hallucinogenic
